content:
Diagnosis:	Intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasm (IPMN) of pancreas
	Incidental finding on CT abdomen performed 15 March 2024
	MRI pancreas with MRCP 28 March 2024 confirms 2.1cm branch duct IPMN in pancreatic body
	EUS-FNA cytology 10 April 2024 - low grade dysplasia, GNAS mutation detected
?
[redacted name] is a 68-year-old gentleman who was referred following the incidental finding of a pancreatic cyst on CT performed for investigation of non-specific abdominal pain. The CT demonstrated a 2.1cm cystic lesion in the body of pancreas, with subsequent MRI/MRCP confirming features consistent with branch duct IPMN. There are no high-risk features on imaging, with no solid components or mural nodules. The main pancreatic duct measures 3mm in diameter.
?
Endoscopic ultrasound with FNA was performed on 10/4/24, showing low-grade dysplasia on cytology. Molecular analysis has detected a GNAS mutation, supporting the diagnosis of IPMN. Serum CA19-9 is within normal range at 15 U/ml.
?
I have discussed the diagnosis and management approach with [redacted name]. Given the size <3cm, absence of high-risk features, and low-grade dysplasia, I have recommended surveillance rather than surgical resection at this stage. We will arrange follow-up MRI in 6 months, with annual surveillance thereafter if stable. I have provided written information about IPMNs and symptoms that should prompt earlier review.
?
The plan is for MRI pancreas with MRCP in October 2024, followed by clinic review. I have also referred [redacted name] to our specialist pancreatic nurse for ongoing support and education.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: branch duct IPMN with low grade dysplasia

cancer_timeline.value: Incidental 2.1cm pancreatic cyst found on CT abdomen
MRI/MRCP confirms 2.1cm branch duct IPMN in pancreatic body, main pancreatic duct 3mm, no high-risk features
EUS-FNA shows low grade dysplasia, GNAS mutation detected
Serum CA19-9 within normal range at 15 U/ml

patient_facts.value: No high-risk features on imaging, no solid components or mural nodules

status_updates.value: Incidental finding of branch duct IPMN with low grade dysplasia. No high risk features requiring immediate intervention.
Recommended surveillance rather than surgical resection due to size <3cm, absence of high-risk features, and low-grade dysplasia
MRI pancreas with MRCP in October 2024
Clinic review after MRI in October 2024, referral to specialist pancreatic nurse
